entries: Each talent has a list of powers that you gain at the Kinetic levels noted in the talent description. Once you gain a talent power, it doesn't count against the number of powers known.

entries.name: Physical Acumen
entries: At 2nd level, Kinetic heroes develop superior physical abilities. You gain proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} and {@skill Athletics}. If you already have proficiency in one or both, you now have expertise. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency.

entries.name: Action Surge
entries: Also at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible bonus action.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. When you reach 18th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

entries.name: Reflexive Powers
entries: Starting at 3rd level, 1st-level power use is now reflexive for you. This means that you have a limitless supply of 1st-level power slots. If you wish to use abilities at higher level, however, you must expend a higher-level slot as normal. [See "Reflexive Powers: An Example" sidebar on p. 25 in Chapter 3.]
As your heroes level up, the levels at which they can use their powers reflexively also increases. At 7th level, for example, 2nd-level power use is reflexive as well as 1st-level.
Consult the chart prior to see when heroes gain the ability to use higher-level powers reflexively.

entries.name: Potent Critical
entries: At 5th level, your critical hits become more devastating, whether through Strength, Speed, or skill. You roll one additional damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit.

entries.name: Kinetic Control
entries: At 9th level, your innate control of your Kinetic energy heightens. You have advantage on {@skill Athletics} checks to resist being shoved or knocked {@condition prone}. Furthermore, you have advantage on saves against effects that would move you against your will.

entries.name: Physical Perfection
entries: When you reach 13th level, your mastery over all aspects of your physical body reaches its pinnacle. You have advantage on all Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saves and skill checks.

entries.name: Agility Kinetic Talent
entries: Some superheroes exhibit superhuman agility, dodging bullets, parkouring up tall buildings with ease, and more. If you select agility as your Kinetic talent at 1st level, you gain the following features.

entries.name: Agility Kinetic Talent Powers
entries: Agility Kinetics know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Skirmisher
entries: When you choose the agility Kinetic talent at 1st level, you become hard to pin down. On your turn, if you make a melee attack against a creature within five feet of you, that creature cannot make an opportunity attack against you for the rest of your turn, allowing you to slip away unharmed.

entries.name: Parkour
entries: When you reach 6th level, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. What's more, you have advantage on any Dexterity-based save or skill check.

entries.name: Total Freedom
entries: At 15th level, you are always under the effect of the {@spell freedom of movement} power.

entries.name: Ultimate Agility
entries: At 20th level, your agility exceeds all limits. You automatically succeed at all Dexterity saves against effects that you can sense. Also, you have a +10 bonus on any Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, or {@skill Stealth}) skill check.

{@i She knows my name, this medium. She shall not utter it or will be broken, mind and body. But she may have uses that can be leveraged against those meddlers and clowns. She adds to my knowledge of thoese oddities, for gain.}

entries.name: Speed Kinetic Talent
entries: Some heroes are strong, while others are fast—superhumanly, impossibly so, moving at incredible speeds.
If you select speed as your Kinetic talent at 1st level, you gain the following features.

entries.name: Speed Kinetic Talent Powers
entries: Speed Kinetics know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Fleet Footed
entries: When you choose the speed Kinetic talent at 1st level, you achieve running speeds usually found only among Olympic champions. Your base walking speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Blazing Fast
entries: When you reach 6th level, your base walking speed triples. Furthermore, opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage.

entries.name: Permanent Speed
entries: At 15th level, you are always under the effect of the haste power, no {@status concentration} required.

entries.name: Impossible Volocity
entries: When you reach 20th level, you become the avatar of speed. Your base walking speed multiplies by 10, you Armor Class increased by 2, and you can move away from foes without triggering opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Now Fast?
entries: At 1st level, a Kinetic hero with the speed talent and a human ancestry has a base walking speed of 30 feet, which increases to 40 feet from the Fleet Footed feature. At 6th level, their base walking speed triples, thanks to the Blazing Fast feature, which brings their base walking speed up to 120 feet. Thanks to the Permanent Speed feature, the hero's speed doubles again, rising to 240 feet. At 20th level, therefore, their base walking speed jumps by a factor of ten, to 2400 feet per turn. That's almost 300 mph, without even dashing or using any powers. By using a power like {@b burst of speed}, you can outrun the fastest jet!

entries.name: Strength Kinetic Talent
entries: Superheroes with the Strength Kinetic talent are truly mighty, hitting harder than anyone else. If you select Strength as your Kinetic talent at 1st level, you gain the following features.

entries.name: Strength Kinetic Talent Powers
entries: Strength Kinetics know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Destructive
entries: When you choose the Strength Kinetic talent at 1st level, you gain advantage on {@skill Athletics} checks to push pull, lift, and break objects. What's more, your carrying capacity (including maximum load and maximum lift) doubles. Thus, your carrying capacity is now your Strength times 30 and your capacity to push, drag, or lift things is your Strength times 60.
Finally, when you make a melee attack, you score a critical on a 19 or a 20

entries.name: Heavy Lifting
entries: When you reach 6th level, your carrying capacity (including maximum load and maximum lift) multiplies by 10. Thus, your carrying capacity is now your Strength times 300 and your capacity to push, drag, or lift things is your Strength times 600.
Furthermore, you count as a Huge creature in terms of Grappling contests.

entries.name: Unstoppable Force
entries: At 15th level, your carrying capacity (including maximum load and maximum lift) multiplies by another 10. Thus, your carrying capacity is now your Strength times 3000 and your capacity to push, drag, or lift things is your Strength times 6000. Finally, you count as a Gargantuan creature in terms of Grappling contests.

entries.name: Avatar of Might
entries: When you reach 20th level, your strength once again amplifies explosively. You know the {@spell impossible strength} power, if you did not before, and you can use it reflexively.

entries.name: Teleporting Kinetic Talent
entries: A few remarkable heroes can travel through space instantaneously, teleporting themselves and sometimes others. If you select teleporting as your Kinetic talent at 1st level, you gain the following features.

entries.name: Teleporting Kinetic Talent Powers
entries: Teleporting Kinetics know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Micro-Teleportation
entries: When you choose the teleporting Kinetic talent at 1st level, you begin subtly and subconsciously moving through space in tiny jumps. Though otherwise undetectable and unnoticeable to the naked eye, you now have advantage on Dexterity saves and {@skill Sleight of Hand} checks.

entries.name: Triple Jump
entries: At 6th level, you can now travel further, faster. When you use your {@spell misty step} power, you can make three successive jumps, each up to 30 ft, in a single round, rather than one. You can make a single attack or interact with an object in between the jumps, but you cannot move or use a power until after the last jump is complete.

entries.name: Superior Teleporting
entries: When you reach 15th level, your ability with the teleport power grows. Now, when the GM rolls on the teleportation result table, they roll twice and take the higher result.

What's more, when you use the {@spell misty step}, {@spell dimension door}, {@spell limited teleport|S5E}, or teleport powers, you may decide whether to retain your momentum as you teleport or not, and in which direction you move when arrive after teleporting.

entries.name: Teleportation Mastery
entries: At the 20th level, your mastery over teleportation is complete. The teleport power is now reflexive for you. Furthermore, whenever the GM rolls on the Teleportation Result Table, they must treat any roll of 59 or lower as a 60.

entries.name: Toughness Kinetic Talent
entries: Some superheroes aren't necessarily super strong or fast, but they can withstand attacks and soak damage beyond the limits of anyone else. If you select toughness as your Kinetic talent at 1st level, you gain the following features.

entries.name: Toughness Kinetic Talent Powers
entries: Toughness Kinetics know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Durable
entries: At 1st level when you select this Kinetic Talent, your Hit Dice for your Kinetic levels becomes a {@dice d12}. Thus, you calculate your HP for Kinetic levels as follows:
{@b Hit Points at 1st Level}: 22 + your Constitution modifier
{@b Hit Points at Higher Levels}: {@dice 1d12} (or 7) + your Constitution modifier per Kinetic level after 1st.

entries.name: Take a Hit
entries: When you reach 6th level, you can use the {@spell turn the blade|S5E} power as a reaction when you take any bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage dealt from a source you can sense.

entries.name: Soak Damage
entries: At 15th level, you know the {@spell protection from energy} power if you do not already. This power does not count against your total number of powers known. You can use the {@spell protection from energy} power as a reaction when you take any acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder damage.

entries.name: Ignore Damage ("I Can Do This All Day")
entries: At 20th level, you can ignore damage that would kill anyone else. When you take damage that would drop you to zero HP, you can use your Reaction to drop to 1 hit point instead. You can do this even when the amount of damage would be enough to kill you outright. You can do this once each round.

entries.name: {@class Martial Expert|S5E}
entries: Some superheroes blast with elemental powers and others attack with sheer, brute strength. The Martial Expert, however, channels their power through training and selfdiscipline, empowering them to do things with their fists, feet, weapons, and mind that no one else can.

entries.name: Origin & Nature
entries: Martial Expert superheroes usually develop their powers after years of specialized training. On the other hand, you may also have inborn ability, or have been granted a powerful gift. You might even wield magical weapons that grant you your powers.

entries.name: Creating a Martial Expert
entries: Martial Experts tend to focus on one of two areas, though each Martial Expert is skilled in all areas. When making a Martial Expert hero, choose {@b hand-to-hand} or {@b weapons} training regimen. Your choice of regimen determines what some of your superpowers are and how they manifest, as well as granting you special benefits in certain circumstances.

entries.name: Class Features
entries: As an Martial Expert superhero, you gain the following class features.

entries.name: Hit Points
entries: {@bold Hit Dice}: {@dice 1d10} per level
{@bold Hit Points at 1st Level}: 20 + your Constitution modifier
{@bold Hit Points at Higher Levels}: {@dice 1d10} (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per Kinetic level after 1st
{@bold Saving Throws}: Dexterity and Wisdom

entries.name: Martial Practice
entries: At 1st level, your modern Martial Practice gives you mastery of combat styles that combine unarmed strikes with that of melee and ranged weapons. You gain the following benefits while you are wielding no heavy weapons and not wearing heavy armor in combat:

items: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and weapons.
You can roll a {@dice d6} in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike or weapon. This die changes as you gain levels, as shown in the Martial Practice column of the Martial Expert table.

When you use the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action. For example, if you take the {@action Attack} action and attack with a baton or a semi-automatic pistol, you can also make an unarmed strike as a bonus action, assuming you haven't already taken a bonus action this turn.

entries: Certain martial traditions focus on weapons. For example, if you trained in Tàijí quán, you might use a dao (like a scimitar) or a qiang (like a spear), combined with circular strikes, to dominate your foe. If you studied Kyūdō, on the other hand, you would use a yumi (like a long bow), interspersed with powerful punches. If you trained in gun fu, however, you might learn to wield two pistols and combine shots with devastating elbows and knees. Whatever name you use for your weapon, you can use the game statistics provided for the weapon in the Weapons section.

entries.name: Focus
entries: Starting at 1st level, your training allows you to focus with exceptional, almost superhuman, intensity. Your access to this intensity is represented by focus points. Your level determines the number of points you have, as shown in the Focus Points column of the Martial Expert table.

You can spend these points to fuel various focus features. At 1st level you know three such features: {@b combo attack}, {@b artful defense}, and {@b agile step}. You learn more focus features as you gain levels in this class.

When you spend a focus point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you refocus your efforts and remember the wisdom of your training. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your focus points.
Some of your focus features require your target to make a save to resist the feature's effects. The save DC is calculated as follows:
{@b Focus save DC =} 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
{@b Focus attack modifier =} your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

entries.name: Combo Attack
entries: Immediately after you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can spend 1 focus point as a bonus action to make two unarmed strikes, or two attacks with a light weapon in your off hand, instead of one.

entries.name: Artful Defense
entries: You can spend 1 focus point to take the {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action on your turn.

entries.name: Agile Step
entries: You can spend 1 focus point to take the {@action Disengage} or Dash action as a bonus action on your turn. If you do, your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

entries.name: Deft
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} and {@skill Stealth}. If you already have proficiency one or both, you now have expertise. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency

entries.name: Unencumbered Movement
entries: Starting at 2nd level, thanks to your honed reflexes, you now have advantage on initiative. What's more, your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing heavy armor or wielding heavy weapons. This bonus increases when you reach higher levels. The bonus to your normal movement increases from 10 feet to 15 feet at 5th level in this class, to 20 feet at 11th level in this class, and to 30 feet at 17th level in this class.

entries.name: Training Regiment
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you commit yourself to a specific training regimen: {@b hand-to-hand} or {@b weapons} (detailed at the end of the class description). Your regimen grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

entries.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.
The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 18th level in this class.

entries.name: Focus-Empowered Strikes
entries: Starting at 6th level, your unarmed strikes cut through defenses that can normally resist such attacks and cancel any resistance to bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries: At 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a detonating grenade or a fireball power. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity save to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the save, and only half damage if you fail.

entries.name: Meditative Mind
entries: Also starting at 7th level, you can use your action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Stunning Strike
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can target a foe's pressure points to cause exceptional pain. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon or unarmed attack, you can spend 1 focus point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution save or be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Improved Focus
entries: Your training brings you to levels that border on the superhuman. At 10th level, you may now spend 1 focus point for a use of any of the following powers: {@spell catch your breath|S5E}, {@spell guidance}, {@spell turn the blade|S5E}, {@spell resistance}, and {@spell true strike}. When you use these powers, they are not superpowers, however, but focus abilities.

entries.name: Perect Health
entries: At 13th level, your life-long commitment to training and self-mastery makes you immune to disease and resistant to poison damage. You also have advantage on Saving Throws against the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Free-Running
entries: Also at 13th level, you gain the ability to move up or along vertical surfaces on your turn without falling during the move.

entries.name: Focused Resilience
entries: Beginning at 14th level, your superhuman focus and commitment grants you proficiency in all saves. Additionally, whenever you make a save and fail, you can spend 1 focus point to reroll it and take the second result.

entries.name: Perfect Balance
entries: At 15th level, you have developed the grace of a ballet dancer combined with the agility of an Olympic gymnast. You have advantage on all Dexterity saves. Furthermore, thanks to your grace, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks that rely on moving silently.

entries.name: Advanced Focus
entries: At the 18th level, your focus abilities continue to improve. You may use the true strike, guidance, or catch your breath powers as a bonus action. Further, when you take damage, you can use your reaction to use turn the blade against that instance of damage. Finally, when you make a save, you may use your reaction to activate the resistance power before rolling your saving throw.

entries.name: Perect Form
entries: At 20th level, when you roll for initiative and have no focus points remaining, you regain 10 focus points.

entries.name: Training Regimens
entries: Two regimens of martial training—either {@b hand-to-hand} or {@b weapons}—are taught in militaries and martial arts schools across the globe. Most training schools practice only one exclusively, but a few are more varied and instruct each Martial Expert hero according to their aptitude and interest. Both regimens rely on the same basic techniques, diverging as the student grows more adept. Thus, a Martial Expert hero need choose one only upon reaching 3rd level.

entries.name: Hand-to-Hand
entries: Martial Expert heroes who adopt the Hand-to-Hand regimen are the ultimate masters of melee combat, whether armed or unarmed. They learn techniques to push and trip their opponents, manipulate their focus to heal damage to their bodies, and practice advanced meditation that can protect them from harm.

entries.name: Open Hand Techique
entries: Starting when you choose this regimen at 3rd level, you can manipulate your enemy's focus when you harness your own. You gain a +1 to hit and damage with unarmed strikes.
Furthermore, whenever you hit a creature with an unarmed attack granted by your Combo {@action Attack}, you can impose one of the following effects on that target:

items: It must succeed on a Dexterity save or be knocked {@condition prone}.
It must make a Strength save. If it fails, you can push it up to 15 feet away from you.
It can't take reactions until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Wholeness of Body
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to heal yourself. As an action, you can regain HP equal to three times your level. You must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

entries.name: Fearless
entries: Beginning at 11th level, you can no longer be {@condition frightened}. What's more, your frequent brushes with death have given you a familiarity with it few others possess. When you are reduced to 0 HP but not killed outright, you can spend a focus point to drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Quivering Palm
entries: At 17th level, you gain the ability to set up lethal vibrations in someone's body via an intimate knowledge of pressure points and the nervous system. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 3 focus points to start these imperceptible vibrations, which last for a number of days equal to your level. The vibrations are harmless unless you use your action to end them. To do so, you and the target must be on the same plane of existence. When you use this action, the creature must make a Constitution save. If it fails, it is reduced to 0 HP. If it succeeds, it takes {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage.
You can have only one creature under the effect of this feature at a time. You can choose to end the vibrations harmlessly without using an action.

entries.name: Weapons
entries: Martial Expert heroes who adopt the Weapons regimen are unparalleled in the use of their chosen instruments, performing impossible feats against amazing odds.

entries.name: Signature Weapons
entries: Choose two weapons of your choice. You are proficient with these weapons, even if you had not been before. When wielding these weapons, you gain the following benefits:

items: With signature weapons that are ranged or thrown, you can ignore partial and ¾ cover and have no disadvantage to attack at long range with them.

While wielding a melee signature weapon, you may attempt to parry visible attacks; when you are hit by an attack, you may use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your Armor Class, even if you have already added it once. If this raises your AC above the attack number, the attack misses.
You gain a +2 to hit and damage with these weapons.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: At 6th level, your signature weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20

entries.name: Ranged Weapons
entries: Also at 6th level, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with your signature weapons.

entries.name: Trade Blows
entries: At 11th level, when a visible creature hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to make a weapon attack against the creature with one of your signature weapons, if you are wielding one, and if the target is in range of the weapon.

entries.name: Focus-Infused Shots
entries: Also at 11th level, your signature weapons cut through defenses that can normally resist their attacks and cancel any resistance to their weapon damage.

entries.name: Superior Critical
entries: Starting at 17th level, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20 with your signature weapons.

entries.name: {@class Mastermind|S5E}
entries: Some heroes don’t have superpowers, or amazing tech, or decades of training, yet they still earn fear or respect thanks to their superior intellect, tactical insight, and ability to command Minions to accomplish their goals.

entries.name: {@class Mentalist|S5E}
entries: Whereas Kinetics channel their superheroic powers through the body, Mentalists manifest power through the mind. Some move objects with a thought, while others read and control the thoughts of others. Still other weave illusions in the minds of their foes.

Because their powers are largely mental, many Mentalists do not outwardly display their superpowers. Some do, of course, with glowing eyes or visible waves emanating from their forehead, but most appear mundane.
Mentalist heroes can be exceptionally dangerous. When you can throw your foe with a thought or force them to attack their allies, you can dominate a battle.

entries.name: {@class Metamorph|S5E}
entries: Metamorphs are a diverse collection of heroes with strikingly different powers. Some can turn {@condition invisible}, others intangible; others merge with an alien symbiote; still others can adopt the appearance of other people; and a few can even stretch and alter their flesh in impossible ways.
There is one thing they all have in common, however; they all can perform fantastic feats by altering their bodies. When facing a Metamorph, it is hard to predict what threats you might encounter.

entries.name: {@class Mystic|S5E}
entries: Elemental heroes tap fundamental forces and elements of the universe, like gravity or heat. Mystic heroes, however, access powers more eldritch and arcane, but no less real and potent.

Whereas Elementalists might shoot ice or light, the Mystics, on the other hand, use subtler, stranger methods. Some are witches, hexing foes, while others study the ways of the arcane. A few deal with the spirits, perhaps even with archetypes like Life or Death itself. These eerie powers make Mystic heroes uncanny and unpredictable.

entries.name: {@class Special Agent|S5E}
entries: Most heroes have superpowers, either from superpowered physiologies, super-advanced technology, decades of intensive martial arts training, or, occasionally, from a potent artifact. A few brave mortals lack superpowers, yet still fight along with the other heroes. They bring know-how, grit, and unique training to bear to fight for what they believe in.

entries.name: {@class Tech|S5E}
entries: Most heroes rely on enhanced or mutant genetics to gain superpowers. The Tech hero makes their own.

No matter how you might have gained the tech, you now have the gear to grant you awesome powers that allow you to stand shoulder to shoulder with other heroes. Of course, some would suggest that someone non-powered who chooses to fight against superpowered foes is foolhardy indeed, no matter the tech involved.

entries.name: {@class Vitalist|S5E}
entries: Vitalist heroes hold sway over some aspect of the natural world. Some Vitalists call upon legions of animals to do their bidding, while others manifest animal traits themselves. Still others command plant life, channeling plant toxins or other properties.

Some Vitalist heroes take on the appearance of their natural domains, coming to resemble an animal or something botanical in nature. Others, however, only present those qualities when they wish, perhaps transforming into a mundane looking human at times. Still others never change their bodies at all, instead commanding the natural world around them to serve.

race.name: Alien (Ancestry)
entries: There are an endless number and variety of aliens in the universe. Some are indistinguishable from humans; others are so different that many humans do not even recognize them as sentient beings. Work with your GM to describe what your alien superhero looks like and how that might affect them if they interact with typical Earthlings. Because of your alien physiology, you have the following traits.

entries.name: Age
entries: Aliens vary so widely that some emerge from the birthing process as adults, while others take centuries to mature. Similarly, some live only a few years while others are nearly immortal.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most alien superheroes are roughly human in size, varying from 4 to 8 feet in height. If you fall in that range, your size is Medium. Some are smaller, with heights of 1 to 4 feet tall making your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Aliens typically have a base walking speed of 30 feet, though your Alien Physiology trait (see following) may alter this number.

entries.name: Alien Physiology
entries: You may look very different from humans in many ways and there are some traits that grant abilities humans lack. {@underline Choose two of the following traits}, though note that the Flight, Extraterrestrial Mutation, Inorganic Physiology, or Natural Manifestation options each count as two choices.

entries.name: Broad-Spectrum Sight
entries: The dark conditions on your ancestry's home planet have granted you superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You have {@sense darkvision} out to 60 feet.

entries.name: Climbing
entries: Your hands and feet evolved for climbing and clinging to vertical surfaces. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Fleet-Footed
entries: Your alien limbs can propel you along the ground more rapidly than humans. Your walking speed is 35 feet.

entries.name: Hardened Skin
entries: You have unusually resilient skin or, perhaps, scales) which provides you extra protection. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Proficiency Bonus + Dexterity modifier (maximum 2). You can use your hardened skin to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: Your ancestry is more highly evolved for survival. You roll {@skill Perception} checks with advantage.

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: Your alien physiology includes claws, fangs, barbs, a spiked tail, ram's horns, or some other bodily weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you can deal damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the normal damage for an unarmed strike. If your natural weapon is claw-like, the damage is slashing. If it is fang or stinger like, the damage is piercing. If it is like ram's horns, the damage is bludgeoning.

entries.name: Resistance
entries: Your home is a harsh environment compared to earth. You have resistance to one of the following forms of damage: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder. If a creature or an object has resistance to a damage type, damage of that type is halved against it.

entries.name: Toughness
entries: Perhaps your planet has an unusually high gravity, or maybe it is simply a harsh environment. Either way, your HP maximum increases by 1 for each level.

entries.name: Toxin Resistance
entries: Due to the hostile environment on your people's planet, you have advantage on saves against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Extraterrestrial Mutation
entries: Your alien ancestry evolved to possess a power typically only found among mutants on Earth. You are not a mutant among your people; instead, all your people possess a remarkable ability. You have the Mutation feat ("Feats"). Note: if you choose this option, you may not choose a second Alien Physiology trait.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You have some means of flight, such as wings or the ability to move yourself through the air with your mind. You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. Note: if you choose this option, you may not choose a second Alien Physiology trait.

entries.name: Inorganic Physiology
entries: Your people followed a very different evolutionary path than humans. You have the Inorganic Physiology feat ("Feats"). Note: if you choose this option, you may not choose a second Alien Physiology trait.

entries.name: Natural Manifestation
entries: Your species evolved closely intertwined with nature. You have the Natural Manifestation feat ("Feats"). Note: if you choose this option, you may not choose a second Alien Physiology trait.

race.name: Aquatic (Ancestry)
entries: Unbeknownst to most of the Earth, there are societies, some ancient and powerful, that have chosen to remain hidden at the bottom of the deep oceans. Millennia beneath the sea has granted your people the following traits.

entries.name: Age
entries: Aquatic people age more slowly than humans do, reaching maturity in about fifty years and living close to five hundred.

entries.name: Size
entries: Aquatic people are roughly human in size and shape, though they tend to have blue or green skin and small fins along their arms and legs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking and swim speeds are 30 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: Your people were once land-dwellers but have long since evolved to reside underwater. You can breathe comfortably in both air and water.

entries.name: Deep Sea Sight
entries: Sunlight rarely reaches the depths of your aquatic cities, so your ancestry grants you {@sense darkvision}, allowing you to see in dark and dim conditions.

entries.name: Resilience of the Depths
entries: Your people have spent millennia at the bottom of the ocean. You can ignore the effects of water pressure due to depths and have resistance against cold damage.

race.name: Human (Ancestry)
entries: Humans, or homo sapiens, are the predominant sentient species on Earth. They have the following traits.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Typical humans vary widely in height and build, from almost 5 feet to upwards to 7 feet tall. If you fall in that range, your size is Medium. Some humans are little people, with heights of 3 to 4 feet tall. If your height falls in this range, your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Versatility
entries: Earth has a variety of climates, as well as some limited experience with superheroes, mutants, and even, perhaps, aliens. Throughout, humans adapt surprisingly well, even taking to life in outer space if necessary. This diversity is a strength, granting you one skill proficiency of your choice.

race.name: Mutant (Ancestry)
entries: Mutants, or homo sapiens mutans, are humans who are born with a rare genetic difference that grants them unique abilities. They have the following traits.

entries.name: Age
entries: Mutants age the same as non-mutant humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Like humans, typical mutants vary widely in height and build, from roughly 5 to 7 feet tall. If you fall in that range, your size is Medium. Some are little people, with heights of 3 to 4 feet, if in this range, your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Mutation
entries: Each mutant human possesses a distinctive, inborn power or ability. You possess the {@feat Mutation|S5E} feat, which grants you a single 1st- or 2nd-level power (See "Feats" in Chapter Six).
Alternatively, your mutation changes your body; you gain the Alien Physiology feature from the Alien Ancestry.

race.name: Mythic (Ancestry)
entries: A few heroes hail from ancient and legendary lines, such as the Amazons, the Arthurian Court, Beowulf, Boudicca, Cúchulainn, Gilgamesh, Kundalakesi, or Susanō no Mikoto. Descendants of such heroes have the following traits.

entries.name: Age
entries: Mythic heroes tend to live somewhat longer than humans, reaching ages up to 150 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Mythic characters are human is size.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Mythic Talent
entries: Mythical humans hail from lineages of great and primordial power. You know the mighty focus at will power and the heroism 1st level power and can use it once, regaining the ability when you complete a long rest.

race.name: Robotic (Ancestry)
entries: Whether created on earth or by aliens among the stars, you are a synthetic being. Perhaps you are made of iron and powered by steam, or of high-tech polymers and running on a fusion engine. You may look roughly human or be obviously artificial. Either way, you are inorganic, don't have biological needs, and others around you are likely to be aware of that.

entries.name: Age
entries: Robots generally are fully formed adults when created and do not age, though they can break down over time from damage or wear.

entries.name: Size
entries: Robotic superheroes tend to be humanoid in size and shape, though they can in principle have any number of configurations. Describe what your character looks like. You choose whether your size is Small or Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Inorganic
entries: Your constructed nature grants you certain advantages over organic beings. You do not need to eat, drink, or breathe. You neither need sleep nor can be put to sleep by any means. You must spend four hours a night in low activity mode, however, which requires that you remain immobile but alert to gain the benefits of a long rest. You may still speak in this mode. You are immune to disease as well, though computer viruses could in principle affect you, based on your GM's discretion. Finally, you have resistance to poison damage, and advantage on saves against being {@condition poisoned}. Despite your inorganic nature, superpowered and mystical healing still mends you and first aid kits can patch holes and stop leaks, effectively working on you as well.

entries.name: Robotic Resilience
entries: You are made of sterner stuff than flesh. As such, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, which supplements any armor you might wear.

background.name: Alien (Culture)
entries: Growing up among the stars or in an alien civilization can provide someone with an almost limitless range of possible experiences.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one ability score to increase by 2 and choose another to increase by 1.

entries.name: Extraterrestrial Diversity
entries: Alien cultures are so varied that you could have had an opportunity to learn virtually anything. You are proficient in one skill and with one tool of your choice.

entries.name: Galactic Knowledge
entries: Having lived in space and traveled the stars to come to Earth, you are likely familiar with other alien civilizations. You have advantage on Intelligence checks concerning extraterrestrials, their cultures, and their technologies.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You speak one Earth language and one alien language of your choice.

background.name: Ancient Earth (Culture)
entries: Whether you traveled through a time portal or were in suspended animation for millennia, you grew up on Earth in the distant past. Maybe you were raised in prehistoric Europe or medieval Africa. Regardless, you have skills and experience that modern Earthlings don't.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one ability score to increase by 2 and choose another to increase by 1.

entries.name: Handy
entries: You learned how to use tools to survive or make a living. You have proficiency in {@skill Survival} and with one set of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

entries.name: Omnivore
entries: The humans of the past lacked refrigeration and sanitation. Your digestive track, therefore, is much more resilient than that of a modern human. You have resistance to poison damage and have advantage on saves against the {@condition poisoned} condition as well.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You speak one modern Earth language and one ancient or medieval language of your choice.

background.name: Aquatic (Culture)
entries: You were raised in the ancient and wondrous undersea cities of an aquatic people, learning their ways.

entries.name: Aquatic Affinity
entries: You have interacted with and studied sea creatures for much of your life. You have proficiency in Science and advantage on skill checks to interact with or to know about the ocean and its creatures.

entries.name: Expert Swimmer
entries: Having lived much of your life there, you have mastered moving through water. You have a swim speed equal to your walking speed. If you already have a swim speed equal to your walking speed, then your swim speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You speak one Earth surface language and one aquatic language.

background.name: Future Earth (Culture)
entries: Through some method time travel, you have arrived in the present from one possible future Earth. You may not be as familiar with contemporary Earth culture, but you have a command of technology that few modern Earthlings could match.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one ability score to increase by 2 and choose another to increase by 1.

entries.name: Enhanced Immune System
entries: Growing up in the future means that you and your ancestors have been exposed to new and deadly futuristic pathogens, either naturally occurring or engineered. You roll with advantage for saves concerning disease. You also have resistance to any damage caused by a disease.

entries.name: Tech Adept
entries: You have proficiency in either the Science or Technology skill, and you roll the skill with advantage when dealing with high-tech or futuristic technology.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You speak one modern Earth language and one futuristic language of your choice.

background.name: Modern Earth (Culture)
entries: You are a citizen of modern-day Earth and, as such, are familiar with its ways.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your ability scores each increase by 1.

entries.name: Familiarity
entries: You are intimately familiar with Earthling lifeways. You have advantage on any knowledge roll that concerns everyday human life or common knowledge about Earth, including its politics, history, geography, and so on.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know two Earth languages of your choice.

background.name: Modern Earth (Culture) VARIANT
entries: The multiverse is varied and strange. Perhaps you are a human with a difference. You may hail from an alternate reality Earth or simply be an unusual individual from our own.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Instead of the Ability Score Increase feature listed under the Modern Earth culture, you may add +1 to two traits.

entries.name: Variant Feat
entries: Choose a {@feat Feat|S5E} at character creation.

entries.name: Familiarity
entries: You are intimately familiar with Earthling lifeways. You have advantage on any knowledge roll that concerns everyday human life or common knowledge about Earth, including its politics, history, geography, and so on.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know two Earth languages of your choice.

background.name: Mythic Realm (Culture)
entries: You were raised in a land of myth and legend. Perhaps you were raised in the court of the Fey, or in a hidden enclave of ancient warriors from mythology. The modern, mundane world most likely confuses or amuses you, though your unfamiliarity with its ways can sometimes be an obstacle.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one ability score to increase by 2 and choose another to increase by 1.

entries.name: Magical Exposure
entries: Growing up in a mythic realm has exposed you to magical and supernatural energies. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and advantage on {@skill Investigation} checks to determine the true nature of illusions.

entries.name: Mystical Acquaintance
entries: Growing up among mythic beings and magical phenomena has given you awareness of such things. You have proficiency in the Mysticism [{@skill arcana] skill, and you roll with advantage when dealing with a being or phenomenon related to your realm.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You speak one modern Earth language and one mystical language of your choice.
